name: Turbine
tagline: Turbine is an easy to set-up and manage load-balancer and reverse proxy management interface complete with RESTful API to enable automated third-party application integration.
body:
### Welcome to Turbine.
Turbine is an easy to set-up and manage load-balancer and reverse proxy management interface complete with a RESTful API to enable automated third-party application integration.

Turbine is developed in [PHP](http://www.php.net) and uses [nginx](http://www.nginx.com) (a support fast, stable web and proxy server) to provide a simple to manage, uber-stable reverse proxy and network load-balancer.

Turbine provides a super-simple RESTful API to enable easier integration with third-party web hosting control panels such as [ZPanel](http://www.zpanelcp.com) and other software.

### Installation
You can install the latest 'development' snapshot by  running the following on your Linux server (currently Ubunu 12.04 LTS is the only supported OS) but other versions may work too!

`wget https://github.com/bobsta63/turbine/archive/master.zip`

`unzip master.zip`

`cp turbine-master/scripts/install.sh ./install.sh`

`chmod +x install.sh`

`sudo ./install`

When asked what directory to install from, type:

`./turbine-master`

That will then install all of the required packages etc. once completed you should be able to login with the default username and password (being: admin/password) and then add rules as required.

### Authors and Contributors
Turbine was written in 2013 and is actively maintained by Bobby Allen (@bobsta63) the software is released under the MIT license.

### Support or Contact
For the time being, please open a 'bug' on GitHub for support requests and I'll pick them up and reply as and when I get time.
